522784470 The Commission now sees a way around this It wants to resort to a clause in Article 122 of the EU treaty which allows governments to decide in a spirit of solidarity between Member States upon the measures appropriate to the economic situation The Commission wants to interpret this to mean that in light of the enormous financial stakes in this case a qualified majority of nations will suffice to approve a sanctions roll over robbing Hungary of a potential veto One of the diplomats said this strategy was a way to secure Belgium's backing The EU s lawyers agree that the fluid language of Article 122 justifies overhauling the unanimity requirements because a reversal of the sanctions would wreak havoc on the European economy That reading could also be used to reduce the frequency of sanctions renewal votes from every six months to once every three years said the diplomats briefed on the discussions Time is now of the essence because failure to reach an agreement will leave Ukraine on a shoestring budget to fight Russian forces before its coffers run dry in April The alternative is for EU taxpayers to shoulder the cost of Ukraine's war while Moscow's sanctioned billions remain untouched The key question is whether the Commission's latest legal gymnastics will satisfy Belgian Prime Minister Bart De Wever and prompt him to allow the release of the Russian funds from the Euroclear bank in Brussels De Wever's office declined to comment on the legal fix The question of how to overhaul the EU s sanctions rules has been debated for years in Brussels' corridors of power In October the EU executive suggested using European Council conclusions from last year as a legal basis to keep Russia s assets frozen until it pays back post war reparations But several countries opposed this idea fearing that using old political statements to dictate future policy would set a dangerous precedent

comment: We still aren t having the single most important political discussion This affects your daily life way more than immigrants or trannies ever could This is why line must go up why we keep launching new wars why everyone is in debt why you can t afford a quarter of the lifestyle your parents had on four times the salary Nobody s talking about the monetary system because nobody seems to understand it I ll try to fix that All money is debt Inflation is the cost of interest All money is created through borrowing and lending Private banks counterfeit the ENTIRE money supply not one single dollar in circulation is a direct liability of the Treasury To illustrate Bob needs 10 000 to buy a car Bob goes to Moshe Finkelstein Bank and takes out a 10 000 loan MFB creates two accounting entries one asset the loan contract worth 10 000 and one matching liability a demand deposit added to Bob s account in the amount of 10 000 10 000 in newly created money has entered the system without any involvement from the central bank or the government Bob buys his car from Joe the 10 000 in demand deposits are transferred from Bob s account to Joe s account Joe doesn t immediately cash out the full amount MFB now owes Joe up to 10 000 whenever he wants it on demand paid in federal reserve notes Bob owes MFB 10 000 plus INTEREST yet only 10 000 in newly created money has entered the system Since there is never physically enough money in circulation to cover the interest someone somewhere down the line ALWAYS needs to borrow more The compounding cost of borrowing the entire money supply is shipped down the supply chain to consumers by raising prices on goods Inflation is interest Which is why it compounds over time and why it accelerates when rates rise and decelerates when rates fall contrary to monetarist quantitative theory

The agreements of cryptography by Langley primarily refer to the work of Adam Langley a prominent security engineer formerly at Google and currently at Cloudflare particularly his contributions to post quantum cryptography PQC and key agreement protocols His work focuses on implementing and standardizing new cryptographic methods in real world protocols like Transport Layer Security TLS specifically to prepare for the potential threat posed by quantum computers to current public key cryptography standards Key aspects of his work and associated agreements or documents include Experimentation with PQC in Chrome In 2018 while at Google Langley conducted an important experiment within the Chrome browser using a post quantum key exchange CECPQ1 to evaluate its real world latency impact in TLS sessions The experiment was successful showing minimal latency impact and proving the feasibility of hybrid approaches RFC 7748 Langley co authored Request for Comments RFC 7748 an Internet Research Task Force IRTF document that specifies Elliptic Curves for Security defining the use of curves like X25519 and X448 for Elliptic Curve Diffie Hellman ECDH key agreement protocols Hybrid Key Exchange His research led to hybrid designs for TLS which combine traditional elliptic curve cryptography like ECDH with a post quantum key encapsulation mechanism KEM such as NTRU HRSS This ensures that the communication remains secure even if only one of the underlying cryptographic methods is resistant to future quantum attacks Specifications for Protocols Langley's work informs specifications for key agreement protocols designed for secure messaging such as the X3DH Extended Diffie Hellman and PQXDH Post Quantum X3DH protocols which aim to establish shared secret keys with post quantum forward secrecy and mutual authentication Thanks for this tho Super cool I was not aware of this

107421336 Elaborating on this the issue and conflict about DAC sound is ultimately driven by the narrative Amir pushes that everything must be absolutely transparent and that distortion is failure rather than creativity Schiit's perspective has always been distortion and other quirks within amps and DACs combined with the distortion already present in headphones and IEMs can generate unique listening experiences which can upscale depending on the quality of the headphones The science isn't so much that DACs can't change sound its whether you believe everything should be tuned to a Harman curve and generate that sound transparently or not Amir has been financially incentivised to push Harman research for years he sold their luxury products at his home sound system business and is taking Topping shill money currently while Marv is obviously extremely close with the Schiit guys Whatever you decide really comes down to understanding the bias on both sides looking at the testing which Schiit does more of these days and your own listening experiences

today on MicroJeet news Microsoft Breaks File Explorer Dark Mode With Latest Non Security Microsoft has released the KB5070311 non security preview update for Windows 11 offering enhanced support for dark mode enthusiasts However this update introduces an issue with File Explorer's dark mode causing parts of the app to occasionally flash The problem results in the application window briefly displaying a blank white screen before loading files and folders Actions that can trigger this include launching or switching from the Home and Gallery sections opening new tabs toggling the Details pane visibility and requesting additional information during file copy operations While this is not a critical security issue it may produce inconvenience to users accustomed to dark mode Although Microsoft hasn't yet resolved this issue and has listed it in the known issues section we've managed to recreate what the bug looks like before it returns to normal It usually lasts for only a second but it's enough to be annoying especially if you're using dark mode The company is working on a fix which will be included in a future non security update package So those who prefer dark mode will need to endure the inconvenience of flashing white squares a bit longer It also raises questions about what causes this behavior within File Explorer With recent issues that Microsoft is actively addressing it might be due to conflicts between Win32 UI elements and modern WinUI XAML overlays microsoft breaks file explorer dar k mode with latest non security upd ate

107412992 OPEN BACKS HD598 Almost everyone has owned a pair of these or started here Still the best entry levels you'll find HD6xx Anything from the 600s drops 650s 660s these are all good and everyone has a rite of passage here Super EQ dependent and great under different amps Not the most comfortable though made me want to use speakers for years Can be modded JAR600 6XX HD800 TOTL reference for most same comfort issues but almost unmatched sound until recently Scales absurdly well with gear or tuning Most redditors run these through entry level stacks or cheap Chifi and absolutely don't get anything out of them Also has a JAR mod Focal Utopias Scale extremely well like the HD800s The transient response is what separates these from HD800s and gives the Focals their own identity also more comfortable Pair this with a DSHA3F N and you're in heaven honestly OG2020s more neutral 2022s warmer and bit more bassier ZMF Atrium Zach rules love his tuning and builds Low ends are great for an open back boutique as fuck though so pricy Zach seems to have solved earpad science too a lot of other brands are coming to him to manufacture theirs ASR fags will screech at you for enjoying his stuff since it's nowhere close to Harman targets STAX SR L700 Electrostatics require ecosystem investment with specific amps but outside of the sub bass roll off these are amazing Most audiofags claim sub bass sucks anyway so that shouldn't be too much of an issue Fatigue free and comfy for something so bright ETA Uli new boutique coming out has been getting rave reviews at recent CanJams in NY SoCal and Dallas Uses Alnico speaker tech hence the giant can size to improve sub bass and lows in an open back Super comfortable uses ZMF custom pads Most people say this blows the HD800s out completely 16 ohm impedance and extremely sensitive meaning these will suck to drive properly for most systems

107418957 Many people don't go back to box cone speakers after listening to planars Like all speakers there are compromises that must be made but if you work around them then they are sublime for normal listening rooms and volumes If you do want to hear it for yourself you can get old used Magnepans for pretty cheap that have the tall true ribbon tweeter If you're in the USA then they most likely will still supply replacement parts in case anything goes wrong Look for models with an R at the end like 2 6R Electrostatics are superior though but they're not nearly as robust so I would not recommend getting used ones like I did unless you're aware of the future hassle and cost of repairs Keep in mind they are not very good at bass either unlike when used in headphones The best solution seems to be to use a dipolar open baffle subwoofer array to mix with the dipolar planar loudspeaker to get the proper in room response Still good planars set up and EQ'd properly can easily go down to 30 40 Hz with very tight bass ie doesn't excite room modes due to dipolar radiation pattern I listen to all kinds of music on mine I'd post measurements but I am still setting up and treating my new listening room so they are still a bit shit and I don't want to embarrass myself haha

107418552 bro it's electric control that means you need a bootleg ipad welded to your car's dash it makes sense A button can be part of an extremely simple control circuit The central control module can basically run bare metal firmware that reacts to dash button inputs and changes the behaviour of various systems accordingly A tablet dash basically needs a fully fledged OS You need layers of software you need touchscreen drivers you need UI libraries you need apps running in userspace you need window management and under the hood you still need drivers for either individual hardware like the AC unit or more likely the actual underlying control module that still handles it directly Unless that doesn't exist anymore and the infotainment itself directly interfaces with every subsystem But in that case I'm pretty sure the AC will have its own controller with its own firmware anyway there's no way the dash CPU is wired directly into the hardware control of everything So I'd much rather press a button to send a signal to the control firmware than fucking tap a touchscreen on an app running on either a bootleg homegrown OS stack or stripped down android or something and I'm not sure which is worse and hope it sends the correct signal to the firmware controller I realise that maybe I'm in the minority because I don't even know what the fuck android auto does exactly but I do know that it's infotainment and having a big screen for that in your car that's independent of the hardware control is not at all the same thing as having basic functions of your car be controlled by fifty layers of software indirection

107419001 A tablet dash basically needs a fully fledged OS You need layers of software you need touchscreen drivers you need UI libraries you need apps running in userspace you need window management and under the hood you still need drivers It seems overly complex but unlike your ever changing Linux distro on your PC most car infotainment software is often based on pretty well understood software Automotive grade Linux just now supports the 5 5 kernal which is 5 years old Once the software is in the car it's going to be fairly unchanging aside from bug fixes the OS is going to be immutable and will never see any new versions of anything If it works today it'll work forever unless there is a hardware failure Apps that interact with the internet are a different story but it seems that recently that car manufacturers have discouraged actual apps in exchange for android auto carplay which is basically screen mirroring from a phone Unless Google Apple massively changes the protocol that will also work almost forever

107416904 I have a relative who has a medical condition that results in very shitty circulation and makes it rather important that they never get too cold They tried all 3 heated vest heated gloves heated soles In their opinion heated vests rarely put out enough power to make a difference and it's your torso so realistically it's already the hottest part of your body Heated gloves are good but a pain to do the wiring for in his opinion Also a big deal if you can get ones that aren't badly made most are gimmicks The one thing he does use are heated soles Again most cheap ones suck ass though similar to 107418602 's reports though socks are worse than soles But take a step back and ask yourself why you'd want that Actively heated adds a shitton of complexity and risk for failure needs recharging and there's a reason it isn't widespread in areas that are historically cold Why not read up a bit on layering and the logic behind outdoor clothing You don't need to actually get outdoor clothing just understand why then get clothes that can do that I guarantee with some basic understanding of layering you can be cozy warm at freezing temps easily without needing to look like an onion If it's for commuting or something short each day but you don't want the bulk or frequently switch between warm and cold areas you can also plan the layering such that you can quickly switch out one or two and go from surviving in the siberian tundra to ready for a meeting in a business casual setting within a 5 minute bathroom break If you're interested look into ECWCS Just skip to the GenIII layering system mesh underlayers and general outdoor layering techniques DO NOT just copy them they are for different settings but understand the why and where On a related note if you find a decent quality clone of a Brynje mesh base layer on ali please tag the OP and link it I've been looking and can't find shit but always wanted one

107419768 My problem is would a HEPA filter be enough My intuitive answer not based on actual facts is no But this is one of those great is the enemy of good situations Dosage makes the poison so just because it's not enough to perfectly eliminate everything doesn't mean it's not worthwhile Ideally you'd get a professional one that acts as a fume hood of sorts I suspect that's not an option so alternatively you'd do it somewhere with better ventilation I assume that's also not an option so then the question is what's a reasonable way to help and fan hepa filter activated carbon filter should do adequately Though you'll want to check if then the fan is strong enough and maybe want a DIY shroud so the air has to pass through both stages

Some of my christmas orders arrived Wooden animal puzzle 2 87 Better than expected The backplate is adequate the paint is consistent and most importantly the tolerances on the pieces are loose meaning there's some play Great for toddlers still struggling with motor control too tight would be bad for that Wooden animal box 6 30 Probably my highlight in this set Each figurine looks pretty cute it comes with a bunch of cards with suggestions how to stack them as challenges and even some wood with a slot as a card holder While the toddler is too young they can just play with the animal figurines then in half a year or a year they can start stacking them One of the plastic latches is broken which is a shame but what can you do I fear I have introduced a great evil into my sibling's life though in that getting all the figurines back into the box once they are out is surprisingly hard took me 3 tries kek So the parents might hate me for it Then again given the broken latch they'll likely not use the box much anyways 401 and 495 glue 1 20 each These are for me I already have some 401 glue and it works amazingly well for insanely cheap so I got a refill and some 495 for where you don't want to use 401 Given the highway robbery local stores do with superglue legitimately 1 g or 1000 kg this is a must own RC diecast models 11 20 each The quality is great They have a small and simple suspension front and back lights and 3 different speed settings The remotes are also paired to only their device so all 3 work at once without interfering thankfully Charged via USB C and the model itself still looks good without power The only downside is they aren't that fast You'll definitely want to have a course with tighter corners or some obstacles to have fun for a straightforward race they just don't get fast enough to make it exciting Then again for indoor they are fast enough in my opinion No real stinkers in the order nice

107413057 It doesn't matter Buy a mouse that costs more than 10 Or don't it'll still be fine if it's not too shitty If you really want to get a proper mouse then you will have to decide what kind There are three main categories FPS Moba though they're not always called that MMO FPS mice have only two side buttons and are generally optimised for ergonomics and weight since lighter mouse let you aim with more precision easier If you're gonna be playing well FPS games or in general games where rapid and precise mouse movements are important but having tons of buttons isn't then get an FPS mouse Moba mice is the general category of gamer mice with a decently large collection of buttons They're often just called gamer mice or whatever They are usually easily 3 4x heavier than an FPS mouse and often sacrifice an ergonomic shape in order to fit more buttons or sometimes even just to have a cool gamer look for no reason but if you'll be playing a variety of games and don't care about precise aim but want a bunch of buttons to easily press to free up your keyboard hand it's not a bad choice The G502 the other anon recommended falls in this category MMO mice are the ones with an entire numpad style keypad on the thumb side usually 12 keys IMO they're strictly better than moba style gamer mice because you get more buttons to bind anything you want to them they're even good for office productivity or for lazy computer use one handed you can bind copy paste alt tab forward back enter switch tabs alt f4 etc etc all on your mouse without having to move your keyboard hand The main tradeoff against general moba mice is the button placement if you prefer G502 style buttons then fair enough even though there's fewer and that there are fewer models on the market so less choice and they can be more expensive sometimes In general avoid spending more than 50 unless you know exactly why you're paying more

107418084 There are two next fests in a year yes at least there have been in the past But when should I start the steam page about my game and trailer with the game Just before the fest Or earlier That's up to you when you start the page I think it doesn't hurt to start the page earlier What should be in the demo One level But the demo shouldn't be released too early There are no strict rules how long it should be but it should show the game in a state that would make people want to play the full game One level could be enough It should make them click wishlist If you get your wishlists above a certain threshold steam will recommend your demo to an even larger audience At least that's the idea Best case outcome is your game showing in the popular upcoming section And then the Next fest ends and then you release your full game Then the best case outcome for that phase is your game showing up in New Trending When I visit steam pages of many games I don't see the demos Only a minority of games have a demo for 3 reasons big AAA games usually have enough marketing money to make bigger marketing campaigns instead of hoping for visibility from a platform like steam you can have a demo page separate from your main game page you can remove the demo at some point if you look at your stats and you see that you got enough wishlists and publicity in general and you just want people to buy your game that's a valid approach off the top of my head I've played demos for Sektori No I'm not a human Date everything They don't have them available anymore Some games like Bloodthief left their demo up though I have mixed feelings about demo because people could just play the demo and not buy the full game Yeah people have very different opinions whether demos help or hurt sales I have no idea really but you can remove the demo later if you want

107419575 500Hz is 8ms delay kys moron Not even most 1000hz boards are true 1 3ms my P1 HE is 1 17ms or something but stock they come at 500Hz which is not great but still under 3ms tested by rtings com iews lemokey p1 he test 6756 HE boards are revolutionary because they have the potential to break the sub 1 ms barrier yes and no HE as in Hall Effect sensors can't the way they're implemented in Keychron's HE line not 8K ones here's a typical HE sensor similar to what's used in these keyboards a files datasheets a1308 9 datashee t pdf I draw your attention to Operating Characteristics table values for tCLP and tPO and also figures 1 2 that is the minimum wait time before taking an ADC reading after powering up the Hall Effect sensor the way Keychron implemented the analog sensor scan they're powering them on one column at a time so they need time to settle take a reading move to the next column until one full read is performed due to these waiting times for accurate readings they cannot break 1kHz and still have accurate readings their 8K HE line uses TMR sensors but they kept HE naming so you know it's magnetic shit since customers got accustomed to the naming scheme but they're using a different way of scanning the matrix or sensors have way shorter settling times

107385087 Qubes Whonix is superior to Tails when it comes to almost everything The one area where Qubes Whonix loses is resistance to forensic data recovery Qubes dispVMs might leave a trace behind on your SSD But you have bigger things to worry about if that becomes an issue Qubes Whonix advantages over Tails sys whonix uses vanguards Tails can't use vanguards because it's amnesic and has a non persistent Tor directory Therefore it cannot use persistent vanguard nodes can run multiple isolated instances of Tor browser or anything else simultaneously starting in Qubes r4 3 Whonix templates have Kloak enabled which obfuscates your typing mouse biometrics Programs running in Whonix have no knowledge of the host's real IP address can't leak IP even if Tor browser gets owned and or you run viruses inside of it on Tails programs running as root can leak your real IP address Programs running in Whonix have no knowledge of host hardware serials UUIDs etc Of course it all falls apart if something manages to escape the VM but that's just an added hurdle that a hypothetical deanonymizer doesn't have to jump through on Tails That being said Tails has some advantages in certain situations Namely It's amnesic and it runs on a live USB so it won't leave any traces of your activity behind on your SSD It hides your MAC address from your local network so local sysadmins can't identify the device you're connecting to Tor from It's more convenient for one off use if you're not looking for a daily driver

107394813 Cold isn t the bottleneck The idea sounds intuitive but fails on basic constraints 1 No meaningful grid Hyperscale DCs need hundreds of megawatts Arctic regions don t have that kind of generation or transmission capacity Building it from scratch is more expensive than cooling in a normal place 2 Zero population zero latency advantage DCs are built near where users or major network backbones are The Arctic is a network dead end You d need thousands of km of fiber for no performance gain 3 Logistics are hostile You need constant shipments of hardware replacement parts and staff Flights boats in the Arctic are inconsistent and expensive Hardware failures become multi day outages 4 Weather isn t free cooling Extreme cold actually complicates things Electronics don t like condensation cycles You still need controlled indoor temperatures and humidity so you build an insulated building with HVAC anyway 5 Construction costs explode Permafrost short building seasons remote heavy equipment transport foundations shifting as permafrost melts This cost alone dwarfs cooling savings 6 Renewable energy is unreliable Solar is useless most of the year wind is intermittent and fuel transport is costly 7 Environmental regulatory barriers Remote ecosystems indigenous land rights stricter environmental impact rules The actual engineering reality Cooling is a small fraction of total hyperscale cost Power networking land access workforce and reliability dominate The Arctic solves none of those and breaks several That s why companies instead build in cold but populated areas with strong grids and fiber Finland Sweden Oregon Canada not the actual Arctic

107400274 I worked in a datacentre in England for eight years Although keeping the rooms cool is important you also want to keep the temperatures steady and control humidity While you can save money on cooling by pumping in air from outside this is called adiabatic cooling you still need the air conditioning units to pump the cold air in and clean the air and keep temperatures and humidity steady so you aren't going to save that much money You would also run into numerous other problems if you just stacked up a bunch of servers in the woods nice and cold but with leaves and animal shit getting sucked into the fans All this is before we consider the general infrastructure of Russia you would need two separate power feeds for redundancy in case one has a power cut You also need to run literally thousands of miles of cables to that location because there won't just be dark fibre under the ground like you get in good countries You also need generators in case any of the power infrastructure fails and you need to generate your own electricity This requires red diesel which is easy to get but not easy to deliver to a remote spot in the Siberian tundra And red diesel goes off if it isn't used you need to drain the tanks and put in new diesel maybe once a year so it's not a one and done kind of thing And most importantly what do you do if something breaks You can have a retard in the building like I was who can press the Power button twice if a server crashes But experts are regularly required for more complicated things We had about 200 deliveries of individual RAM sticks over the years because one of our customers some small software company had multiple racks of Dell servers which had all been built with faulty RAM and Dell wouldn't replace all the RAM just the RAM that was faulty So it would sometimes happen 2 3 times a week that a certified Dell engineer came in replaced one DIMM that arrived separately and left again

subject: Manual Memory Management
comment: Been reading up on MMM lately and wound up reading Ginger Bill's series on allocators So far in my career I've seen three patterns for memory management past the C minimum 1 Leave it to GC 2 Borrow checking Rust 3 RAII with tools like smart pointers C All of these assume that you're going to be slinging arbitrary sized data onto the heap at more or less random points in program execution and need something to manage those allocations Ginger Bill alleges this is not true and that most of the time you really know how much memory you're dealing with That opens up a new option 4 Allocator based management From what I understand the principle is to preallocate necessary memory to complete a task complete it without worrying too much about memory efficiency within the task and then release all the memory at once I expect this would be very efficient for low level computing like graphics which Ginger Bill seems to think about a lot But I'm not convinced that his allocation breakdown makes sense unless you're counting trivial stack allocations that nobody has trouble managing in the first place Certainly it doesn't seem to hold in the OOP world of enterprise software which is what pays the bills for me Daemons and web servers have constantly shifting allocation sizes according to business need and most of the garbage I deal with is in his top right corner Anyone try programming this way How did it work in practice

You guys are absolutely wasting your life on this This is the most premature optimization imaginable I work as a contractor and I'm brought in to fix shit other people wrote One round trip to the database dwarfs all your memory allocation concerns for the entire function method whatever I just spent a day dropping a page load from 2000 round trips to the database down to 100 The page is now 10x faster The client is ecstatic At no point in this process did memory allocation make up more than a miniscule fraction of the page load Not before Not after No one cares Going to the heap is like going to the fridge Going to the database is going to Jupiter by comparison You can go to the heap as much as you fucking want and it will never make any goddamn difference at all
107404617 Did you miss where OP said Certainly it doesn't seem to hold in the OOP world of enterprise software which is what pays the bills for me

107404790 So GC or RAII Otherwise you do have to allocate and deallocate it it's just the mechanics of the language If you have to think about allocation or deallocation at all it's a bad language for enterprise It's a language that is wasting your time Your program is going to use a tiny fraction of memory that your database uses The memory used is insignificant The amount of time talking to memory vs database is insignificant The most important memory battle to fight in enterprise is making sure the pinheads in IT who bitch about your database server pony up Those idiots will try to cut you database hardware down to the point it reads off the fucking disk instead of from memory

107404326 It's valid to pre plan your exact memory usage and pre allocate everything Think of an 8 bit console game They had specific memory addresses for things like score health If you had game objects appearing and disappearing such as an enemy sprite appearing on screen they had a set number of memory slots for the object data they designed the game so that there was a maximum limit to the number of objects could appear on screen at any one time In modern software it's still viable If you are reading user data pre allocate the buffer size Use mmap to map files The convenience of allocating memory when needed isn't necessary If you have a complicated program that could do a variety of things you don't know the memory requirements until it starts doing things divide the program into modules so that each module knows its memory footprint and allocate and free memory per module as needed Reducing ad hoc memory allocation is a reasonable style objective If you can't do this there is a good chance your program has scope bloat

107415434 I know I ll never have more than 100 objects on screen I can allocate 100 objects beforehand When the module needs an object a naive approach would be to get an index to the next object in the contiguous memory chunk fill it with the initial data Upon deallocation you just clear the data back to some baseline ready for use Never needing to request memory on the heap it s already there You re just placing temporary data while the object is in use Fuck it s not hard you dipshit I bet you love LINQ where you always call toList losing all semblance of benefit to LINQ where you gain an iterator and instead forcing the entire container to be constructed before moving forward

107415414 107415301 Cloudflare thought it had a known size for their features 107415792 107415775 107415999 107416023 Let me explain anon's point A memory pool with a fixed size is a dynamic allocator over a possibly static resource Just like the rodata or bss text etc are a static allocation over the lifetime of a dynamically executed program Or the page table is a dynamic allocation over the static adressable memory Which is a static allocation over the dynamic hardware you can take out and replace with smaller or bigger one Static and dynamic is dependent on the perspective

Using this method I was able to resolve what looked like a continuous wave tonal around 52 Hz Not a typical frequency for machinery Most shaft rates and blade harmonics fall between 100 400 Hz This was way below that Wasn't an acoustic signal The hydrophone transducers were picking up electromagnetic interference in the analog stage before digitization Looked like a carrier wave on the display Perfectly flat line no modulation no harmonics At 140 knots you should see Doppler shift but there wasn't any Whatever was generating the EM field was moving with the contact First class I worked with I'll call him Harris noticed what I was doing one night Asked me about the technique I showed him the long integration method and the results He told me he'd seen similar data at NAVFAC Bermuda in the late 80s before it closed Old hands there called them fast movers Nobody discussed it officially People who pushed got reassigned Harris also told me something I later verified through other channels During the Cold War the Soviets had their own problem with anomalous acoustic contacts Their submariners called them croakers because of a distinct low frequency signature on passive sonar that sounded like frogs Soviet Naval Intelligence ran a dedicated research program on it from the early 70s through roughly 1988 We knew about their program We had correlated data The signatures they were logging as croakers matched what we were logging as system artifacts or unknown biologics Their program got shut down when the USSR collapsed and the funding dried up Ours apparently never existed in the first place A few years in I got orders to a facility in Virginia Command said it was a SME exchange on sonar processing improvements AUTEC sends operators to NUWC Newport periodically for technical consultations so I didn't think much of it

41589070 I would highly recommend pursuing a commission instead of enlisting On the officer side it can be a bit of a wait to get in as you'll need to get selected by an OCS board then actually ship out then do OCS and BOLC which can take upwards of a year or two in total depending on if you get selected the first time at the board or not The quality of life and income tradeoff that you take on when enlisting instead of commissioning is pretty steep and imo not worth it though it is easier to get into intel by directly enlisting for it rather than commissioning as you have to compete for your officer branch There are also fine details about MI officer career trajectories that basically mean you won't ever get to work on spook stuff unless you get stationed at the right places as a junior officer which you often have little control over On the flip side there are insanely good positions open to officers and even a fresh O 3 35A side note there are almost zero real intel positions for 35A LTs most do branch detail as infantry or armor til they pin CPT can have a massive effect on real world operations compared to your high speed enlisted analyst who's often pigeonholed into this or that narrow position On the enlisted side you're in for about 8 months of BCT and AIT before hitting your duty station Your pay will be vastly lower look up the pay tables they're public and you will be trusted far less especially showing up to your duty station You'll live in the barracks with most likely a 19 year old PV2 and your supervisor will be some 22 year old SGT On the other hand you will directly do intel shit unless you're a 35F in which case enjoy being an S2 lol every day rather than managing supervising resourcing and planning operations like most officers do Up to you as to what to pick Option 3 lurk usajobs clearancejobs and intelligencecareers and just apply for a cleared contractor agency position and see if you get it

41591228 41591259 41591268 You're shifting the focus and mixing DSP ideas with hardware claims that don't match how these systems are actually used If the objective is to detect a narrowband 52 Hz signal there is no need to push sampling into the hundreds of kHz or MHz and build elaborate moving average schemes around it The constraint is SNR and coherent integration time not raw sample rate A 96 kHz 16 bit front end with reasonable gain and filtering is sufficient to pull a 52 Hz line out of the noise using long integration and narrow FFT bins Going to 500 kHz without a corresponding improvement in the analog path mainly increases data volume and out of band noise for no real benefit on a sub 100 Hz contact A moving average cascade is a series of low pass filters Subtracting that result from the raw data produces a high pass residual which removes the low frequency CW content you are interested in around 52 Hz The additional structure about inflection counts and primes does not change that you are still attenuating the band of interest and emphasizing higher frequency components If the goal is line detection and clean spectra long properly windowed FFTs or standard parametric estimators are better suited and straightforward to implement on the platforms in use On the hardware side a microcontroller with 64 GPIO pins does not provide 64 analog channels Those are digital pins and each acoustic element still requires an appropriate analog front end and an ADC At the scale of 10 000 elements the dominant cost and complexity sit in the wet end cabling housings power distribution and timing well before you get to the price of the digital cores None of that changes what I originally described which was a narrowband EM interference signature coupling into an existing hydrophone system and a manual processing approach that made contacts the automated processing tended to suppress easier to see

This story happened to my grandfather who is now 93 years old but at the time he was 14 years old and living on a farm He always told me this story but I finally convinced him to detail it for me When I was young I lived with my family in the countryside on a farm near a small town My father worked on the farm planting coffee and other agricultural products at the time and my brothers and I helped him with everyday tasks such as taking care of the animals we had on the farm such as pigs chickens and horses We also raised some cattle and we had pure milk freely due to the many dairy cows that were there Our farm also sold milk to help with the family income At that time there weren't numerous schools like today and to study we had to walk for about 8 km to another place where a classroom was built with the teacher traveling from the nearest town to give classes for children in our region It was a hard life but I miss that time Well it all started one morning when my father found an ox from his herd dead in the pasture There was no sign of animal attack Except that strangely it didn't have a drop of blood at all and there were two small holes on the right side of his body Very round holes My father found that strange but he couldn't figure out what it was A week or so later my father found another ox dead under the same circumstances The second ox like the first also had no blood in its body and had the same types of holes as the first in its body The place where the oxen were killed was near a large forest in the region Two nights after what happened we woke up at dawn with our dogs barking angrily as if there was someone close to our house So my father already worried about the death of the two oxen took a rifle from our house and went outside with an oil lamp to have a look My mom didn't want him to go but he left anyway Minutes later we heard two shots and then my father came home scared

So we asked him why he had shot and he told us with wide eyes that he was near the pigsty when in the nearby woods he heard a noise so he lit it with the lamp but he couldn't see clearly Suddenly in the moonlight he saw in the woods a creature about eight feet tall walking upright standing and when it turned to my father's side it's eyes were red as if they were lit And that was when my father shot it and came home scared We asked him if he hit the shot and he said he didn't know but that we were supposed to go check it out in the morning because that thing shouldn't be from this world Needless to say we were all scared of what my dad saw especially from my dad who wasn't afraid of anything and was tall and strong Early the next day we all went out to see if there were any blood marks or traces where my father said he had seen the creature We looked around and found no blood but strangely we found some footprints we had never seen before They were of a type of two legged animal with five long fingers looking like the marks of some kind of lizard and they were heading towards the dense the woods that were close to the site Curious about what happened my father went to talk to his neighbor and friend Mr John telling him what had happened on our farm My father asked if something similar had ever happened in his place Mr John told him that not like that but that he had heard strange noises at night near his house like a grunt and the dogs were barking all night long It was then that my father invited Mr John to go out on a hunt to het the creature that was prowling our lands Two days later they set out to hunt the creature l very curious wanted to go too because I really wanted to know what it was At first my father didn't want to but he ended up letting me tag along So on the appointed day early in the morning we left me my father my uncle Bill and our neighbor Mr John

So we started hunting that strange creature My father carried a rifle my uncle and Mr John each carried a hunting pistol I imagined what we might find along the way We went into the forest looking for footprints but found nothing So when we arrived at the edge of a large lake that existed in the region Mr John called us to show us some different footprints he had found They were very similar to the ones we found on our farm the night my father spotted and shot the creature So my father said that the creature should be around We then followed those strange tracks but mysteriously after about 300 ft they disappeared We were all amazed at the disappearance of the footprints as the ground was soft in that patch of forest We wondered how they could disappear like that We walked for a few more hours and found no sign of the creature Then we returned home Arriving home my mother already worried was waiting for us anxiously asking if we had found something My dad said no but we'd look it up another time Some time passed until a few days later when my father found another ox dead in his pasture and by the signs of it it had been killed in the same way as the previous ones There were as before two holes and not a drop of blood on its body My father was enraged by that and said it was too much So he called Mr John again and said they would go after the creature at night as that was when it attacked My mother knowing that didn't want to let him go but my father was stubborn He said that it was decided and that he was going to solve that problem because he didn't want to see his animals dead anymore So early in the evening the next day we all got together and went after the strange creature that was attacking our cattle As before my father Mr John and my uncle took their weapons My father and Mr John each carried a torch and my uncle and I an oil lamp

We went into the forest and stayed in the nearest area as he attacked at night my father figured it shouldn't be far As we walked we kept trying to look for tracks but we didn't find them due to the darkness and the little lighting we had available Arriving in a clearing at a certain point in the forest my father decided to take a break and build a fire It must have been about 10 o'clock at night or so So we stayed there talking for a while and always looking around It was a night with a full moon but with some clouds with the moonlight illuminating the darkness of the night a little I believe we stayed there for about an hour and a half talking After resting we went back to walking and headed towards a small river that crossed that part of the forest There we began to look for more traces until in a certain part of the bank my father called us to show us something They were the same footprints we had seen before and they were recent So the creature should be around We followed the footprints which entered the forest but as before they mysteriously disappeared My father was angry about that as it was the second time we lost track of it So he decided that we should go in the direction the footprints were going We continued through the woods for a long time until in a certain place we began to hear sounds of the bushes moving and sticks breaking as if someone or something was moving It wasn't that close but it indicated something We headed in that direction where we had heard the noises As we approached the noise ceased So we were looking around looking for clues to something but we didn't see anything except Mr John and my Uncle who found broken tree branches and crushed weeds indicating that something had been there My father then prepared his rifle and the others drew their pistols

We stayed for a few minutes in that place in silence looking for something or some sound that would draw our attention Then a few minutes later we heard a noise coming from the woods just ahead We went there carefully I was already in a cold sweat from all that dread I felt at that moment We went through the forest along a very precarious type of trail that existed there Ahead there were many more trees than where we were and the darkness was increasing due to the poor light from the moon At that point in the woods on the right side of the trail we heard a noise of twigs breaking and then a kind of grunt I got goosebumps all over We then slowly took a few more steps very slowly and carefully towards the sounds It was when looking into the darkness of the forest with the help of torches and lamps just a few feet ahead we saw it His eyes were red looking like lit fires It looked like a type of two legged lizard and was approximately 8 feet tall His body looked like an alligator only smoother looking damp Its hands or paws had huge claws and its teeth looked like those of dinosaurs from the movies pointy and sharp When we came across the creature it stared at us and let out a roar so loud I was almost deaf My dad and the others were helpless for a few seconds in fear They were paralyzed We all were When my father managed to react and point the rifle at the creature it turned and took a leap so big it looked like it had springs in its feet disappearing into the woods My father my uncle and Mr John shot several times towards the creature but they certainly missed because with the speed that it disappeared it wouldn't be possible to hit it We didn't speak for a while and I started to cry It's a little embarrassing but I couldn't help it So my father immediately ordered us to go home as according to him and his beliefs it wasn't of this world We quickly returned home all panicked

then I had to go down this enclosed little passage with trees and shit blocking anything above me basically nothing could see you when you walked down this passage but I couldn t get away because she just kept talking and she got weirder too started talking about A killing his sister again she started asking me questions about it seemed almost like she was quizzing me and trying to get my opinion on what I thought of him I think I made an offhand comment saying I thought he was weird and seemed a little fucked up this was basically entirely based on my roommate because I barely knew the guy she kinda clammed up at this point so I took it as my exit cue so I m heading down this enclosed path and after about a minute of walking I heard something behind me suddenly it sounded like a branch snapping or something I turned around very quickly only to see a tall shadowy figure on the path behind me and before I can even ask wtf is going on I hear a voice call out to me telling me not to worry It was A s voice what the fuck alarm bells were instantly ringing in my head the way my roommate s sister was just talking about him quizzing me clamming up when I said I thought he was evil there is no way this wasn t some kind of setup he must ve either been listening or been told I was now shivering and wondering whether to just book it or play it cool I wondered what would ve happened if I didn t hear that branch snap would this psycho have just snuck up on me I decided to turn back around and just keep walking like nothing was up I knew he d catch me if I ran my door was locked my roommate was asleep and I wasn t exactly the most athletic he d either outrun me completely I would trip or he he d catch my while I tried to unlock my door I heard the steps behind me get faster and closer and I knew I had to be ready to fight but A just started walking beside me

started talking about how today would be his sister s birthday nervous jpg I just responded back with a half hearted oh to sorta feign interest in reality I wished people would stop fucking talking about this shit but he just kept on talking I tried to just look forward and keep walking but he just kept talking started telling me how his sister just ran away from home one day and never came back sounded like he was trying to convince himself as well as me I think he was considering whether to fucking kill me or not probably based on my reactions we finally got out of the path but A made no sign of leaving instead of opening the door with my keys I banged on the door for my roommate to wake up he came to the door and looked stunned when he saw A if I m honest he looked a little scared too I went inside and they ended up talking for a while outside he didn t tell me what was said when he finally came back in I tried my best to get some sleep last night but I just couldn t I was paranoid that A was gonna try and sneak up on me or do who knows what I mean wtf was he doing creeping out there anyway what was that shit all about hours passed and it must ve been about 6am when I was finally drifitng off to sleep but I was jolted back away by the sound of cop cars there were a couple of them and they were whizzing past my roommate s sister s house this is a rural area and a rural community even one cop car up here is strange more than one basically unheard of by the end of the day there was a lot of talk why were the police here they had found A s sister s body or what was left of it rather I imagine just skeletal remains at this point I have no idea how you even figure out who they are at that point but yeah it was about half a mile away and buried under some branches and leaves and dirt

it was buried under an old cemetery in the woods not long after they found the remains the police were looking for A he was woken up to cops with guns trained on him my roommate s sister was actually there in bed with him which explains why she was acting like such a fucking fruit loop when talking about him according to her someone had reported the location of his sister s body I don t know who or how or why for some reason he either knew about this or had suspicions that s why he was trailing me that night he thought it was me since I was a bit of an outsider to the area that s why I was being quizzed to see what I knew I was being setup to be killed by A I have no idea why he changed his mind on killing me I have no idea why the stupid fucker went back to his house only to be arrested I guess he knew the jig was up I wish I knew who actually turned him in who could actually know something like this AND keep it quiet for so long cause of death was apparently multiple gunshot wounds to the face basically the opposite of how my roommate s sister described it being

Brazil I was a cop for about 7 years now In the year of 2011 I was transferred to a city called Garanhuns in the state of Pernambuco At the time the city was already big with over 100 000 people living there My job wasn't a chill job by any stretch of the imagination I had to deal with all kinds of twisted stuff you can think about Bar fights shooting knifings you name it Bums using drugs and stealing shit around the town was also a problem But all of that didn't happened as frequently as you would imagine Garanhuns was a very peaceful town for its size Most of the time we would stay at the police station or be idling somewhere around the town At that point I already lived with my now wife The corporation used to send us lunch either that or they would give us money to buy something to eat One of my colleagues told me of an old woman that was selling drumsticks of chicken and chicken pies He told me that they were really good and it was worth buying So the next day at lunch time we looked for the old woman to buy the chicken pies Soon enough we found her I ate one of her chicken pies and they were really good I told the old woman to go through the police station before lunchtime as I knew many of the officers there would absolutely love the pies She thanked me and I got back to the vehicle She started going to the police office to sell some of the pies once or twice a week By the 15th of March we received a complaint from the parents of a girl She had disappeared two days ago she was 20 years old From what we could gather from the situation they were from another neighboring town Apparently their girl got a job offer as a full time nanny and that the client would pay one salary and a half for the job That was an abnormally high payment for a nanny The even told their daughter that but she came to Garanhuns anyway They had no news of her by that point

As messed up as it was that was unfortunately all the information we had They did not have any idea of who hired her or where that nanny job was We forwarded the case to the investigations department but with little hope that anything would come of it We had seen that same story play out too many times by now Parents don't pay attention to their kids lives and they turn up dead in a forest She was 20 and an adult sure but fuck that I would not let my daughter go out like that if I had a daughter They registered the case there and went back to their town In my opinion having someone disappear is one of the worst cases you can have Worse than burying someone dear to you because there is no knowing if the person still out there All we could do was wait It wasn't until the 8th of April that we were told that someone had a lead on the case While the investigation was still ongoing the victim's credit card was used in a store in the city The police got in contact with the store and with the camera images they could identify the person who used it There was a man and a woman at the store The woman was not identified but the man was The man was called George and he lived not too far away from the police station On April 11th just 3 days later we got a mandate for searching and apprehension in George's house We went there My heart sank when I saw that the old lady who sold us the chicken pies lived there Three people were taken to the police station A 5 year old child was with them and had to tag along since he had no other family to watch him George was 50 His wife Isabel was 50 too There was also another woman called Jessica She was just 18 Isabel was the old lady that used to sell chicken pies for us We decided to interrogate Isabel first as was procedure She looked to be under a lot of stress I didn't think she was involved so thought it would be over quick

They actually had found the used credit card in George's stuff As the interrogator began talking to her she began to stutter on her words I was listening to the interrogation but I wasn't at the room It was a surprise to me when she stopped talking and started to cry The following sentences were taken straight from the audio file of that interrogation So you did see Alexandra Falcao Yes Where On a bus So you talked to her but did you know her Yes I mean no What do you mean I she we talked about a job offer A job offer Yes my daughter she needed a nanny Daughter You mean Jessica No the little girl Is she you daughter Yes I mean I take care of her Is she or is she not your daughter She is So did you get in contact with Alexandra Yes After that bus incident No How was the credit card there then She went to our house Oh so you did see her later then ok Did you do anything to her No not me What So was Alexandra harmed in any way there Yes What did you do to her Isabel began to sob and started shaking A man went in there and gave her a glass of water At this point I couldn't believe what I was hearing a completely innocent old lady was somehow involved in all of this However nothing could prepare me for what I was about to hear George he did it What What did he do It made us do it Is Alexandra dead Yes What did you do to her She was impure What do you mean by that We had to do it Please answer the question George George killed her Were you present at the time Yes Was Jessica present at the time Yes Was your five year old daughter present at the time Yes How did he do it He cut her throat And what did he do with the body We had to purify her What happened to the body We buried part of her in the yard Part of her Did you cut her I didn't but George did So he buried her in various parts of the yard No We kept it we kept it

Kept it what do you mean by that We ate it he said it was the only way to purify At this point the interrogator stopped and looked at us outside He was pale and sweating a lot We stopped the interrogation What followed next was a literal storm We found out that Jessica's documents were not hers Jessica was a woman that disappeared in 2008 Coincidentally she had a daughter of 2 years old at the time That led us to believe the worst by now After the interrogation we found out her real name was Bruna and that she was involved in all of this She confessed that they had killed other girls before and that they had consumed their meat That's all the info she told us before she went quiet Bruna was very cold and did not display any emotions She even laughed at us sometimes George refused to talk When we mentioned that his wife Isabela told us everything he said that she was senile When we mentioned Bruna he did not answer They were kept in jail and the next day Isabela was interrogated again This time the interrogator wanted to know more about what happened and where exactly the bodies were This time it was like Isabela was another person She did not display any emotion whatsoever This time a female and a male officer was questioning her I was once again just outside the room The 5 year old was also questioned by a professional and she described everything to details So we talked to Bruna How is she related to you She is my husband's girlfriend His girlfriend Yes Were you ok with that Yes So was Alexandra to be his girlfriend too No she was impure Impure Yes Impure George said so How much meat did you get out of her body 10 Kilograms So ok then how many days did you eat from that meat About 2 Only 2 days No not 2 about 3 Ten kilograms of meat doesn't last only 2 or 3 days It would have lasted at least 2 weeks

It didn't last 2 weeks because Bruna ate more than me So she ate a lot then She was on a diet but she liked meat a lot But I like rice more I don't like meat very much So it only lasted less because of Bruna and the little girl that liked it Did she know what the meat was No she didn't know She thought it was just normal meat So I think it lasted 5 days And you ate a lot of the meat No I don't like meat very much So it was all of the others that ate it Yes the little one ate a lot of the meat So how did she know about the people getting killed I believe she saw everything all of the procedures Ok so you ate the parts of the girls Which parts did you eat Normal pieces like liver and normal parts of the body Did you eat her heart as well No Are you sure Yes Didn't you feel any remorse for doing all this Yes But you still ate either way You used that meat to make the pies didn't you At this time I was selling peanuts But you were also selling pies at that time weren't you Yes but I was selling peanuts But Bruna said you used the meat to make the pies That was a lie Bruna did not say that He told her that to make her speak But but these were made for our home So for you to eat Yes And how would you differentiate the ones you would sell from the ones you would eat Because I was selling peanuts That's a lie you were selling pies I saw you selling pies here I know I sold to you once I think So you used her meat as filling for the pies right Yes I used it Ok and you did the pie Yes And sold them Yes So why don't you confess then But but I sell peanuts Yes you sell peanuts you sell coconut candy and you sell pies And you made the filling with the girls meat and made other people eat it So why don't you just fucking confess As she remained silent the female interrogator left the room The other interrogator then continued

Tell me something the pies you sold here they were made with the meat of which one of the girls On the second Was it Alexandra Yes And where else did you sell those pies Everywhere even at the hospital but it was only that time the rest was peanuts And I used only a little of meat it was more sauce After I heard that I went to the bathroom and vomited I remembered the pieces of meat that there were in the pies Now I wanted to kill that woman It was clear for me now that they were 3 cold blooded killers They lured 2 other woman and killed them in the same way The first one to die was Jessica in 2008 She was living on the streets and they lured her killed her and took her daughter Then 2 more had died that year As the population became aware of the case and the press started reporting on it the population got angry and burned their house down All of them refused to go outside since there was a constant angry mob at the door of the police station The one person that showed us where the bodies were was the kid We had to take the little girl there and she pointed where in the yard the corpses were buried An investigation was opened on George and they found a very disturbing thing George graduated in Physical education and was by no means illiterate He was under license since he was having alleged problems with schizophrenia They also found one thing a book in which he wrote about a lot of things The book was to be a fictional work but it seemed like it was not fictional since it described a very disturbing scene The following texts were taken straight from his book Notice that he changed their names in the book Isabel to Bel and Bruna to Cristina We returned to live in Olinda Pernambuco With the money we had we managed to buy a house there It was a simple neighborhood in the city Cristina had returned to live with us

I made a small living room and there I had coffee every morning with Bel and Cristina I stopped attending psychiatric clinics and taking my medication I was happy But we began to receive visits from a teenager She was very beautiful but strange She came mysteriously played in the yard and smoked a lot The days went by I Bel and especially Cristina could not stand the visits of this adolescent anymore Shadows were with her sinister laughter was emitted by her she was the evil itself As head of the family I had a duty to destroy her One day I took advantage of the fact that the evil teenager was not there and I planned with Bel and Cristina We planned a way to destroy her We came up with this Kill her divide her and bury her Every part of her must be scattered in a different place It was a night of heavy rain lightning and thunder The evil creature was in a room of the house I looked at Bel and Cristina That night was the right moment to destroy the evil I snuck up to the bedroom and could see it through the crack When I opened the door it creaked and before the evil teenager had the chance to react I immobilized her Cristina also entered the room to help me while Bel ran into the kitchen She returned later with a knife The screams of the adolescent evil are muffled by thunder I took the knife and gave a strong and precise stroke striking its jugular The blood sprayed At the same time I felt a hot liquid dripping down between my legs which wet my feet I realized then that she urinated She slowly unfolds in my arms Then I let her fragile slender body fall It made a deep sound as it hit the ground I saw that body on the floor Cristina suspected that she was still alive I take a rope make a gallows and place it on the neck of the body I drag her myself into the bathroom and turn on the shower for the rest of the blood to flow down the drain

As I look at the already dead body of the evil teenager I feel relief I took a sheet and began to remove all of its skin and soon after I divided it I Bel and Cristina fed on the flesh of evil as if it were a purification ritual The rest I buried in our backyard each part in a different place The police traced this book because in 2011 he tried to publish it as a book named Revelations of a schizophrenic At this point they interrogated George again and this time he spoke So George we found your book I see It's really well written Thank you So in it is this girl you mention Jessica Yes but I didn't do it I don't remember doing it You don't remember but you did it Yes So this is all real Yes How come don't you remember then I have flashes I never killed anyone I always respected life I see Then it was as described here The voices they made me do it Voices Yes from the cartel Cartel As in the drug cartel No the voices So you did the same to the other 2 girls I have but I don't remember I am speaking the truth And why eat their meat Why chop them in pieces It's the four elements and the fifth element Water and Earth are the legs air and fire that are the arms And the fifth element that is God It's a purification system that the voices tell me And what does it have to do with the killing To bury each part and each part be blessed Did you feel any pleasure while doing it No I felt pain and sadness Why did you eat their meat It was a purification system Tell me more about the cartel They are the voices Who are they The interrogator stopped there noticing he wouldn't talk anymore Other things happened then It was noticed by the psychological evaluation that all of them were very cold and that George wasn't as insane as he wanted to make himself seem Another search was made in what was left of the house and many candles were found

Once there he saw through the kitchen window a light moving quickly through the undergrowth It was heading towards the top of the hill of banana trees A hill completely surrounded by a dense patch of banana trees He was a little surprised but there wasn't much he could do The next day the farm animals were acting strange He discovered that some chickens piglets and two calves were gone Grandpa connected the dots and thought that light he had seen the day before was a bandit fleeing through the woods with the animals A few days later some neighbors came to talk to my grandfather and told him that some of their farm animals' cubs had also disappeared He told the neighbors what he had seen that night The neighborhood then set up a kind of night watchmen to watch the farms It would be a person armed with a shotgun and a machete mounted on a horse who would be patrolling the roads The neighbors would take turns in that position The watch began when the full moon ended and similarly the robberies stopped Two weeks later the neighborhood calmed down but the neighborhood decided not to stop with the night watch As soon as the full moon returned animal thefts specifically baby animals started again It was a Thursday when my grandfather was on the lookout again He was on horseback on a dirt road when he saw in the distance the woman in red crossing the road and heading into the undergrowth He didn't think that was strange He thought that maybe she lived nearb He didn't even notice the fact that the woman was wearing the same red dress as usual Time passed and the disappearances of animals continued to happen always at the time of the full moon The sightings of the woman in red also continued especially near my grandfather's house

One day my grandfather was explaining the situation to his wife and that's when she said he should find a way to follow her because he heard horse footsteps at night every time the baby cried He said they were louder on nights when the full moon was out She thought it might be something wanting to take the baby since the baby animals were also being taken So on a full moon night armed with a machete my grandfather hid in the bushes near the road that led to his house At a certain point the woman appeared and continued walking towards the hill of the banana trees He followed her stealthily and since it was a full moon he didn't need any lamps to see Then they reached the top of the hill which was a clearing He watched her through the trees as she walked to the center of the clearing She started to dig something up and he soon realized it was a machete She grabbed her hair and lifted her neck then used the machete in her other hand to rip her own head off Her body then bent down and she put her head into the hole where the machete was buried and covered it with earth With that the body was engulfed in flames and transformed into the body of a huge reddish horse But where the head should be there were only flames She neighed and made a terrible noise Then she began to gallop through the woods My grandfather was silent until he stopped hearing the noise of hooves and neighs When he was sure she was far away he went to the center of the clearing In the center of the clearing he dug until he unearthed the woman's head Her head was bloodied and her eyes were closed Not knowing what to do he took out his machete and pierced her head with it At that moment he heard a frightening scream He dropped the head and the machete there and started running He could hear the gallops and neighs of that thing getting closer and closer to him The creature was heading towards the clearing He managed to get home and close the door

41579820 Jung was an honorary jew No retard Jung was a non practicing christian that recognize the role of spirituality in humanity and society and it is well documented that played an important part in his rupture with everything freud Freud saw the younger Jung not only as the heir he had been seeking to take forward his new science of psychoanalysis but as a means to legitimize his own work Freud and other contemporary psychoanalysts were Jews facing rising antisemitism in Europe and Jung was raised as Christian although he did not strictly adhere to traditional Christian doctrine he saw religion including Christianity as a powerful expression of the human psyche and its search for meaning 10 Freud secured Jung's appointment as president of Freud's newly founded International Psychoanalytical Association Jung's research and personal vision however made it difficult to follow his older colleague's doctrine and they parted ways This division was painful for Jung and resulted in the establishment of Jung's analytical psychology as a comprehensive system separate from psychoanalysis i en wiki Carl Jung

41584925 The Red Book though I suggest preceding or supplementing its reading with some of Joseph Campbell's work like the Hero With A Thousand Faces When you understand the framework of what Jung was doing which Campbell and others better translate to the modern reader his own writings become much more useful to your own work He proves being schizo can be a high ritual artform which is why the shills are so desperate to derail it lately Jung referred to his imaginative or visionary venture during these years as my most difficult experiment This experiment involved a voluntary confrontation with the unconscious through wilful engagement of what Jung later termed mythopoetic imagination From December 1913 onward Jung carried on in the same procedure deliberately evoking a fantasy in a waking state and then entering into it as into a drama These fantasies may be understood as a type of dramatized thinking in pictorial form In retrospect he recalled that his scientific question was to see what took place when he switched off consciousness The example of dreams indicated the existence of background activity and he wanted to give this a possibility of emerging just as one does when taking psychedelics

41595773 This is the eastern version of the same tradition taken to China by our Sythian ancestors I consider the Yu Bu core itself as the great invention The zigzag pattern acted when used as a basic part of the yin yang context like a genetic code or life code There is probably no other symbol in the world which can be compared to the Luo Shu The array that he copied became the primary magic square at the deepest numerical core of Chinese philosophy It determined one of the classical layouts of the Pa Kua the eight trigrams of the Chinese oracle of changes the I Ching It was incorporated into the shaman s dance known as the star walk or the Yu Bu The underlying schema of all these are in essence identical to the Starcut The Yu Bu was performed shamanically by a practitioner seen as representing and invoking publicly the powers of the universal Tao The dance took in all the trigrams of the I Ching It also stepped out a count of the Nine Stars in the Heavens Some of the visualizations indicated to be done by the practitioner are extraordinarily vivid and the powers invoked are accorded the status of military generals So the dance had a martial self defended character infusing its stance toward the four directions It comes as no surprise that more recently the numerical sequence has been equated with the transfer of a practitioner s weight in the movements of the supreme ultimate martial art of tai chi chuan

41600362 Again in the region of Ophiuchus and the Tree x marks the spot hoist the main Silver gate is the gate of man incarnating Golden gate is a door to heaven The ecliptic is the apparent path the Sun takes through the constellations over the course of a year defined by Earth s orbit around the Sun The galactic plane is the midplane of the Milky Way Galaxy as viewed from our position within it These two great circles on the celestial sphere intersect at exactly two points termed the galactic nodes Astronomers use these nodes to relate galactic coordinates to the more familiar ecliptic based system Over centuries various cultures have interpreted these points with symbolic meaning For example traditions and esoteric interpretations refer to them as gates The intersection near the constellation Sagittarius and Ophiuchus pointing toward the Galactic Center is sometimes called the Golden Gate while the opposite intersection near Taurus and Orion is often referred to as the Silver Gate Since the Greek inherited much of their wisdom from the Egyptians it's more than reasonable to suspect that the gate or portal mentioned in the Book of the Gates through which the pharaoh enters the Netherworld is in fact the Gate of God that the Greek writer Macrobius writes about The Gate of God was also called the Golden Gate while the Gate of Men was called the Silver Gate The very same Egyptian cross symbolism used by the pharaohs associated with the Golden and Silver gates of the soul and the Sun can still be recognized in the coat of arms of the Vatican consisting of two crossed keys one Golden one Silver Also the skull and crossbones if I'm not mistaken un php
